description: Overview over the most needed and many helpful metrics to manage and debug PostgreSQL servers.

panels.description: The CPU usage, rate over $rate_interval.
panels.title: CPU [$rate_interval]

panels.description: Shows the percentage of used storage on the most used mount.
panels.title: Max Used Storage

panels.description: Determines when the first table will be freezed by autovacuum.
panels.title: Next Freeze

panels.description: The used connections in relation to the limit (reduced by superuser_reserved_connections).
panels.title: Connections

panels.description:
Number of WAL files that still need to be archived.

Can grow under write load but should not increase over longer periods of time.
panels.title: WAL Files Ready

panels.description: The amount of WAL data that still needs to be archived.
panels.title: WAL Ready Growth [1h]

panels.description: Shows the rate/increase in failed archive actions.
panels.title: WAL Archive Fails [$rate_interval]

panels.description: Active WAL senders in relation to max_wal_senders.
panels.title: WAL Senders

panels.description:
Shows the used prepared transactions in relation to max_prepared_transactions.

'N/A' if not used.
panels.title: Prepared Transactions

panels.description:
Shows the maximum of send_lag_bytes, flush_lag_bytes, replay_lag_bytes over all connected streaming receivers.
This is not a sufficient way to monitor if a standby is up to date!
Can only give a hint if streaming is delayed.
panels.title: Max Replication Lag

panels.description: Modified memory that needs to be written back to permanent storage.
panels.title: Memory Dirty

panels.description:
Reads are shown above the 
zero line (>0) and writes are shown below (<0).
panels.title: Read/Write (IOPS) [$rate_interval] - $disk

panels.description:
Reads are shown above the 
zero line (>0) and writes are shown below (<0).
panels.title: Read/Write (bytes) [$rate_interval] - $disk

panels.description:
Reads are shown above the 
zero line (>0) and writes are shown below (<0).
panels.title: Read/Write Time [$rate_interval] - $disk

panels.description:
RX is shown above the 
zero line (>0) and TX is shown below (<0).
panels.title: Network Traffic [$rate_interval] - $interface

panels.description:
RX is shown above the 
zero line (>0) and TX is shown below (<0).
panels.title: Network Packets [$rate_interval] - $interface

panels.description:
RX is shown above the 
zero line (>0) and TX is shown below (<0).
panels.title: Network FiFo Queue [$rate_interval] - $interface

panels.description: Shows how the total time increase over the last $rate_interval.
panels.title: Statements by Total Time Increase [$rate_interval] - $datname

panels.description: The amount of WAL data that still needs to be archived.
panels.title: WAL Files Ready Growth [$rate_interval]

panels.description:
Number of WAL files that still need to be archived.

Can grow under write load but should not increase over longer periods of time.
panels.title: WAL Files Ready

panels.description: Successful and failing archive commands over $rate_interval.
panels.title: WAL Archiving [$rate_interval]

panels.description:
The amount of data a stream receiver like a standby server lags behind the master.

send_lag: Data that still needs to be send (should be small).

flush_lag: Data that was received but must be flushed to persistent storage (this data can be lost if the standby is terminated).

replay_lag: Data that still needs to be replayed by PostgreSQL on the standby (can lag behind during writes in asynchronous configurations).
panels.title: Replication Lag Growth [$rate_interval] - $application_name

panels.description:
The amount of data a stream receiver like a standby server lags behind the master.

send_lag: Data that still needs to be send (should be small).

flush_lag: Data that was received but must be flushed to persistent storage (this data can be lost if the standby is terminated).

replay_lag: Data that still needs to be replayed by PostgreSQL on the standby (can lag behind during writes in asynchronous configurations).
panels.title: Replication Lag - $application_name

title: PostgreSQL Server Overview
